text: Losino-Petrovsky () is a town in Moscow Oblast, Russia. In 2010, 22,550 people lived there. == History == In 1708, a factory for the production of elk leather uniforms was founded by Peter the Great. The village was around the factory called Losinaya Petrovskaya (). The factory existed until 1858, when many other textile factories were created. In 1928, it was granted urban-type settlement status. In 1951, it was given town status. Category:Cities and towns in Moscow Oblast
title: Losino-Petrovsky
